name: James Gwin
text:
SEE SARAH FOR PIERCINGS!!
Sarah has been piercing me for 10 years. The only time I have ever used anyone else is when she took a short break to finish college.
The very first piercings Sarah did for me were my nipples. I was very nervous because I had always been told how painful male nipple piercings, but Sarah made me feel calm and relaxed by assuring me that it was worse in my head, the piercings were a little painful but nothing like I thought it would be. She did such an amazing job, so I've recommended her to everyone. She is always very professional, nice, gentle, and most important quick with a needle.
Since then, Sarah has also pierced my industrial, several other cartilage piercings, 6 Frenums, and my lobes using 6 gauge tunnels. The most recent piercings she did were both of my daiths for migraine relief; the first time in 7 years I have been migraine free for 3 months!!!
Every piercing she has ever done on me has healed perfectly and I have made sure to follow her aftercare instructions to the letter.
However while she was on break I went to 2 different shops nearby for piercings, one with a female piercer and one with a mail piercer/tattoo artist. I had a standard cartilage piercing done by the female piercer. She (along with staff at that shop) was very rude, charged almost double the price, offered no aftercare, insisted on using a ring instead of the bar like I was accustomed to, and told me they were using titanium jewelry.
I used the same aftercare that I've always used but the constant movement of the ring caused my ear to become so infected that I lost 2 completely healed piercings in that ear also. Later I found out that the jewelry they used was not titanium at all (not even titanium coated), it wasn't even nickel and lead tested surgical steel! When I went to the male piercer/tattoo artist's shop the place so sketchy and he was such a jerk that I left immediately.
I WILL NEVER LET ANYONE BUT SARAH PIERCE ME AGAIN. Thank you so much for all of your amazing work.

name: felicia manning
text: Scottsboro Ink Therapy is extremely professional and respectful to their clients. I had a tattoo done with Leroy back in October of a dream catcher with floral arrangement outlining the edges and I was extremely impressed. The staff are all friendly and go out of their way to make you feel comfortable. The shop is clean and very inviting...a sofa is provided for customers to sit comfortably on while they wait for their appointment, large flat screen tv to keep you occupied during your wait, snacks and refreshments are available for purchase, and a public restroom is available as well. Music is played in the background to allow the customers to relax during your session. All needles used are brand new and opened in front of you. High quality inks are used so you can guarantee your tattoo will last and look as good as new for years to come. Touchups are available if anything is needed touched up after the healing process is completed on your tattoo which I loved! I would highly recommend this shop to anyone. The art there is amazing. Just about any tattoo you could want can be done there.

text:
I have to correct the last gentleman's review.  I work with the son of Professor Bob Dunn, who was also trained by Sailor Moses and I can assure you that the Matt Green at this shop is not the one that you are speaking of.  You were done wrong but you have the wrong Matt Green.  I have worked along side the Matt of this shop and he is a very well rounded and fully competent tattooer.  Extremely sterile environment and procedures along with a very pleasant shop experience.

Seriously dude, do your homework before you try to ruin the career and internet presence of a really good dude who is only guilty of having the same name as someone you are angry at.

name: Leslie Helton
text:
I've known the tattoo artists for many years and have watched Matt's skill progress extensively, as I still have some of his earliest work that we have not reworked yet, into the beautiful artwork he now produces!  Stephen's work is very organic and quite awesome to look at.  I met Vance earlier this year when we brought my daughter in to have her cheap wal-mart kit earrings replaced with body jewelry so they could heal, and he was VERY professional.  Recently I had Vance do some work for me as well, and I couldn't stress enough how professional this guy really is.  Very matter-of-fact when it comes to discussing what happens during healing time and what jewelry is best for that location.  I think their shop hours are AWESOME, by treating it more like a business by offering decent hours rather than a quick-stop tattoo mill open til midnight.

Awesome staff, awesome facility, awesome in general.  Best tattoo business in the Shoals, EVER.

name: Amanda Riker
text: My husband and I were out of town and in the greater Birmingham area for a night out by ourselves for our 13th wedding anniversary. We called everywhere starting at about 10 pm. We wanted a new tattoo for each of us to celebrate our anniversary. I was shocked to see all the shops were either closed by 8 or 10 or fully booked and closed at midnight. My husband stumbled upon this place while doing a Google search. He called and the guy Nate said they were not busy to come on in. I plugged it into the GPS and we're were 15 miles aways so we went. We got there and was  greeted by Nate. He helped my husband pic a tattoo and set him up. I had found an image on Google that I wanted to go down my right leg. I texted the pic to his phone and they prepared the stencils. The guy Nate really doesn't give himself enough credit. He said his buddy (the owner of the shop) was better at coverups or whatever but he was busy with another customer. Nate ended up doing our tattoos. My husband's was on his left hand. This guy did an AMAZING job on both our tattoos. We're were both done in just under three hours and the new ink is beautiful! I love it! Also Misty is a wiz at getting you the perfect pircing and offering high quality jewelry! If you havent already been here you are missing out!

text: I haven’t had great experiences in the past with tattoo shops; my first tattoo which held great meaning to me basically got made fun of by the artist. Everyone was so friendly and professional and everything was clean, not to mention the atmosphere was so laid back and they were immediately cutting up with you like they’ve known you forever. My tattoo from the gumball machine turned out fantastic, the process was smooth, the price was very reasonable, and I was taken care of. This shop is wonderful and I sincerely hope they grow and prosper!

Because I am not from the area and I really needed my hair done I continued to wait. 2 hours later she contacted me asking if I was at the shop I informed I was. She said you got the times mixed up and apologized. I'm human I understand that. She said she was coming. So i continued to wait! This was around 12ish. I got frustrated with waiting and left she called saying I'm on my way to the shop now. By this time I left heading back to Bham I had had it to Prattville! I turned around thinking I have a full day ahead i really needed my hair done. So I went back to the shop she still wasn't there. I waited almost another hour after driving 20mins from Prattville. As I was walking out the shop I noticed a lady in her car eating ice cream, nevertheless it was Diedria as if I haven't waited 4 hours for her to do my hair and telling her I wasn't from Montgomery and I had a 9:30 appointment. She asked as I was leaving was I about to go!?!?!? Because her ice cream was more important than keeping a schedule appointment or being professional! Will never go back! Beyond unprofessional

text: I do not recommend 5 points at Scottsboro. They are Very unprofessional and unfriendly. The shop is dirty and has no AC. I scheduled a job here and was put off three times and completely stood up the third time. The first visit he told me we could start drawing and then when I got there for my scheduled session he told me we weren’t going to do anything and handed my session to someone who came in behind me. Both times I showed up for a prescheduled session after driving an hour to get there, there was no one even in the front office to greet me. They were in the back laughing and talking. I waited 30 minutes both times for anyone to even come out and I had to text them both times. The third time Seth completely stood me up. I showed up for a scheduled session and then he says he’s in Kentucky driving home. I was given no warning or anything at all. He claimed his wife texted me but didn’t have service which seems unlikely as it should have automatically sent when service did become available. After waiting another 30 minutes for him to get there he proceeded to tell me they didn’t have internet and would have to go to Walmart to print a stencil. He then went into the back office again and didn’t show back up so I just left. This has been the most unprofessional experience with a so called business I’ve ever had.

name: Gina F.
text:
There's so many good things to say, so it's break this up into shop and artist!

Shop - Thistle & Fern is a lovely and clean shop with a bright and comforting atmosphere. The moment you walk in, you feel at home.

Artist - I have been seeing Cat for some years now, I drive from Madison to see her. And even if she is booked, she is worth the wait! She has a steady, gentle hand and she is very patient and intuitive with her clients. I love how she seems to operate on my wave length when it comes to designs. She always blows me away. And the other artists in the studio are so lovely and friendly as well!

I wish I could give a five star rating a hundred times over! Thank you for always taking such good care of me!

name: William Morgan
text:
Big city artwork with small town charm.

Cat at T&F is putting tattoos into the world that you'd expect to have to fly out to NY or LA for, without leaving Decatur. I could write volumes, but her portfolio honestly speaks for itself.

Call or drop by to set up an appointment, as talent like this can be booked up for weeks (sometimes months). Absolutely worth it to wait instead of just swinging into whatever shop has walk-ins always open.

resp.text: Thank you William!!!

Cat is truly beyond talented!
The only word I can think of to accurately describe her is pure MAGIC!!! I've had all of my work done by her, and I never plan for that to change!
She goes above and beyond to the point that I sent her a picture of a tattoo that I wanted (a watercolor bird skeleton flash art that I found online).
She thought the bone structure looked off, so she took it upon herself to research it. She found the correct skeleton and re-drew it from scratch.
Not many people would ever take that extra step, and that's what makes her extraordinary!!!

name: Kayla Murray
text: The stuff and tattoo artist were very rude! Made hateful comments. I wouldn’t suggest them to anyone. They were the only place open don’t go there!!!

resp.text: You came in less than an hour before closing time and didnt have an image picked out for your tattoo. i started working with you, you told me what you wanted, i explained to you that what you wanted wasnt going to fit in your budget, but i began designing the image you described anyway, to try to come up with something you would like that would be close to what you wanted, but fit in your budget. after i drew up your tattoo that you verbally said that you liked, you started scrolling through google again. by this point, there was only 30 minutes left in the day and i explained to you that we werent going to have time to do your tattoo. that we would be more than happy to try again the following day, or just another day. i was polite and professional, but you became rude and accusing. you left saying you were going to find somewhere else to go, and i told you to have a nice day. then you came back the next day demanding an apology from me and that you would "allow" me to do your tattoo still, if i apologized. the person that spoke to you explained why i didnt owe you an apology, and you left yelling all through the parking lot. with all of that, i am happy that you dont like it here, because we only have time for customers that will treat us with respect. thank you for posting this publicly and giving me the chance to thank you to not come here again.

name: Chapman Lewis
text: I went to get a nose piercing a few months ago and it never healed. I went to go get it looked at from a different place and he told me they pierced it all wrong, used poor quality metal, and used a right hook ring on my left side. I would never ever come here again. They messed up my nose piercing in any way possible.

resp.text: it takes  3-5 months to heal out a nostril piercing. we use only 316l surgical grade steel or titanium. and our titanium is solid, not plated. im sorry that the other place that you went to felt the need to misinform you to try to make themselves look better.

text: Absolutely love my new tattoo I got today at Sugar Skulls . It was a very great experience from the moment I walked in the door and was welcomed by Diane Preister. Diane kept the front moving very smoothly . This is the fourth tattoo I have gotten from Anna. Anna is always very professional and always cleans and sanitizes between every customer. She always asks if I need any edits or any changes and always allows me to check the font for the writing in my tattoo. She always asks me to approve the finaI print out pattern transfer before she prints it out. I definitely highly recommend Anna Argo at Sugar Skulls and any other tattoo artist in this shop to anyone wanting a tattoo or a piercing. I also have had 3 piercings from Sugar Skulls and have not had a single issue or problem with any of them . I was explained how to take care of all of my tattoos & piercings before I left the shop.

text: Best tattoo shop, nationwide!  Chris is a master artist.  I encourage you to follow their Instagram.  I was looking for a specific font.  I wasn’t sure of placement.  Amy brilliantly suggested the inside of my forearm.  Not painful, at all.  This wasn’t my first tattoo.  I won’t even review the W. Hollywood nor the Maui shops; disasters.  Although, I opted for simplicity, you should see the complex and colourful work.  Incredible!  And, as a Sepsis survivor, every doctor appointment is an opportunity for staff to see a visual “medical alert.”  This tattoo literally saved my life.  In December 2015, I was in the ER. (Ultimately requiring a second colon resection.)  The nurse took my vitals.  Saw the tattoo.  I explained I’d survived Septic Shock, with organ failure.  Enter, Dr. Henry Wang, who oversaw my care.  You can find a plethora of journals and abstracts, he’s written; on Sepsis.  Moral?  Best tattoos at OSI.  And, it just may save your life.

text:
I went to Pink’s Ink the day the governor was shutting them down (ya know, quarantine and all) and got a tattoo on my posterior region. My appointment was at 12. Kristen arrived at the shop at about a quarter til 12 and had me come on in. She got the stencil prepared for my tattoo, cleaned and sanitized everything while I was waiting and we got started. She was done in less than an hour. Cleaned and covered my tattoo for the ride home. She was absolutely fabulous. I also bought a gift certificate through her during quarantine (again, remember MeeMaw shut the state down for a while and forbid her to go to work) and she has been in contact with me throughout about getting put on the schedule after she opened.

If you are local or even here on vacation, I highly recommend Kristen. She’s amazing at what she does and she’s an awesome person all around.

text: I actually had a very pleasant experience getting my tattoo. I had to change the placement but that was probably for the best. But other then that, it was nice. I was even thinking of setting up an appointment with Jay to get a large piece done on my leg. The tattoo came out great and my artist was Lane who is usually appointment only but he ended up seeing me and my fiance anyways as a walk in to help out. Though i have no complaints with my tattoo, I gave 3 stars because of a follow up conversation between Lane and my fiance. The night after we got our tattoos my fiance was growing more and more uncomfortable with the font on his tattoo. He loves his tattoo and thinks its beautiful work but he thought the font should be a little more rough and he wanted to try and think of a way to rough it up a little before going back to the parlor and seeing if Lane liked the idea. So he messaged night owl if they still had the stincel that they used for his tattoo. Instead of replying with a no or sending the picture, Lane seemed to have gotten personally offended by this and told my fiance to come to the parlor and face him like a man. This didn't sit well with me at all as my fiance was only trying to get help and he was treated disrespectfully. This is upsetting because my coworker has told me how kind and talented Lane is and me and my fiance were both excited to have him as our artist. Perhaps he was just having a bad night, but either way I am disappointed in the way he spoke to my fiance. I am thankful he went ahead and did pur tattoos even though he didn't have to but he went a bit far. We will probably not go back

name: Jessica Bailey
text:
I got 3 of my tattoos at Night Owl. Adam has done 2/3 of my tattoos and I followed them through three shop transitions (two in Sumiton, and Jasper). My last visit there I was treated very poorly. I was told to wait, so I did. I got there well within the operating hours. I wanted to do a custom piece, which I am aware takes a little more time. I was understanding about them having other work lined up ahead of me. I was told to wait for service and that they would be with me within a 2 hour time frame. I waited the time just to be told they couldn't start even drafting because of it being close to closing time. It literally took under 10 minutes for Expert Ink to do a draft for me. I even got a better price. If I would have been told earlier that they had too much of a workload to do anything for me tonight that would have been acceptable. I would have tried to make an appointment to come back. I understand the artists and everyone have busy lives, but it is completely unprofessional to drive away a repeat customer ESPECIALLY after having them to wait for so long. I also overhead them talking smack about me in the back. I will NEVER go here again. I'm telling all my friends to conduct their business elsewhere also.

UPDATE: When I went to the studio,  Adam,  I was instructed that within a two hour time frame you would be available.  When that time frame was up,  you were working on another client.  I was told that even if I left and came back (so long as it was within the given timeframe, and it was) that I could hold my position in line.  I was ready, willing, and able to wait for you that night. It is the discourtesy in which I was treated that has left a sour taste in my mouth. I have no personal vendetta against you, because I wouldn't have been a repeat customer if I was dissatisfied with your work. You are a very skilled artist.  It is possible that this is a management issue.  You shouldn't advise clients that they will be seen within a certain timeframe and then proceed to take a walk-in over an appointment. It's also completely unacceptable that your apprentice was speaking disrespectfully about me,  especially within earshot.  I would have been willing to forgive the former if it hadn't been for the latter.  I was not getting irate with your staff.  I was agitated that I did as instructed and another person was taken in my place, but I would have still come back after that.  As I have stated,  I do understand how a business operates.  I was also upset that Cody wouldn't allow me the time to make up my mind without rushing me to leave. I was trying to figure out a time that I could possibly come back when your apprentice stepped out and proceeded to bad mouth me.  That is the sole reason I left and refuse to return.  You should work with staff that will not disrespect your repeat clients.

resp.text: Hi Jessica, thank you for your review. This is Adam and I will be the one leaving this reply. I hate that you feel like you were treated poorly, but I also understand that we cant make everyone happy. You did come in around 7:30pm and i had just started on a very large tattoo that would take a few hours. You and your companion Cody were informed by our apprentice who happens to resemble James Franco, that it would be a minimum of two hours before i would be able to stop and consult with you about the tattoo that you wished to get.  You and Cody both left and returned at a later time in which i was still working on the same client. I never rush a clients tattoo no matter what is waiting on me, my full focus is with whatever client i am working with. When you returned, you and your companion became very irate that i wasn't ready for you at that time. As i was finishing up with my client we could hear you both arguing with the apprentice. I finished up with my client and you were told that we could set you up an appointment for the following day, due to the fact that it was now after 10:30pm. That is when you both told us that you would be leaving to go to another shop. I could hear the agitation in your voice and before i could come out there to talk to you personally you had left. I do my best to treat everyone that comes through the doors with the most professional courtesy that I am able to give them. I understand that I am not the cheapest artist around , nor do I claim to be. I do however strive to be the best i can possibly be and treat all my clients with a certain sense of class and respect, even though at some time that same demeanor is not reciprocated. If you would like to come back to the shop and talk with me personally i would be more than happy to accommodate you.

text: I could not be more happy with the tattoo and the service that I got from them today! Not only is my tattoo incredible, but they stayed late..on a holiday..to make my tattoo dreams a reality. Thank you, Bobby for this awesome artwork and everyone at outlaw for putting the costumer first! I will be back!

name: Audrey Simmons
text: I chose to get a tattoo here because of the great reviews. But I am not happy with what I have. To make a long story short, I wanted a blue heart tattoo on my wrist . This was my first tattoo. To make you guys aware, I am black. So when I showed up and told them what I wanted, they said they could do it. So I get it done, and I noticed it faded out a lot. So I go and get it redone and they tell me that I should just cover it black because color doesn’t show up well on dark skin. If they knew this information ahead of time then I don’t understand why they said they could do it in the first place ? They should have informed me on this before tattooing me, especially since this was my very first tattoo.

resp.text: That " information" you wish you knew ahead of time is written on the release form you read and filled out. We are sorry the color did not show on you the way you wanted. We try our best to give every client what they want.

name: Taylor Day
text: Great experience with Steve! I'm in love with how it turned out. Went inside and was helped almost immediately. Consult took 5 minutes. Had to wait 10 days, because of his schedule which to me is a GOOD sign! The day finally came and he was patient with me when I changed my mind on the size. Rocked and rolled and came out with a beautiful tattoo of two realistic feathers! Great to hear that he doesn't do the same tattoo twice! Lots of compliments from friends and family, and one huge recommendation from me.

name: Ricki Oliver
text: I went in for 3 tattoos and a piercing. They were very friendly and professional. The facility was clean. Kenny did an amazing job with my nostril piercing. They even sent me to the Prattville location only because they weren't comfortable with one of the tattoos I wanted. They wanted me to have the best experience possible! I would definitely recommend them to anyone and will be back!

You present your ideas and needs and they are happy to work with you to make your tattoo an artistic piece that you will have forever. I currently have 5 large tattoos that were done by Steve, the culmination of my ideas and his artistic skill. I have at least 2 more large pieces to go and of course Steve will be the designer and artist that makes them something fantastic. This is the only shop I will recommend.

text: The people here are so great!! I'm from Ohio and came down here to visit my family on my spring break, and was very excited to get a tattoo but nervous about going to some place outside of my comfort zone. Everyone was very accommodating and helpful, they were very caring about me and my tattoo today, and in the future. I didn't end up getting exactly what I came in wanting but I'm so glad I listened to their suggestions. I would recommend coming here if you're from this area or even taking a trip just to come here. I will definitely come here again the next time I'm in town. Thanks again guys, I'm so glad I chose you!!!

name: KitN Li
text:
I went to the Prattville location to get my cartilage pierced on 8.22.15. This is my first piercing done on my own (I had lobes done with I was 3/4) I came into the store which is very well kept and clean and was greeted by a very nice lady named Caroline who also did my piercing.

She went over everything with me, let me pick out the stud I wanted put in and the location I wanted it. She then gave me very clear after care instructions before hand and then went over the piercing step by step through the entire process.

Everything was done very professionally and I am more than happy with the out come of my piercing and plan on getting another one done at a later time.

name: Jazmin Price
text: I have to say that Outlaw Custom tattoo has my loyalty as a customer! I started a piece with a different artist, it was unfinished and had some issues. I was upset and asked Outlaw (Steve) if there was anything he could do to help the piece. Not only was he extremely professional and kind but he validated my opinions and feelings by listening to me and hearing me out. We have begun the "fix it process". The piece already looks 100 times better and the experience was wonderful! The environment is comfortable and extremely respectful! I was so happy that two days after my first appt with Steve I paid his other shop a visit and had my nose pierced! AND it was another amazingly wonderful experience! Their piercer is fantastically knowledgeable and wonderful to work with! I will recommend Outlaw Custom Tattoo to everyone and won't step foot into any other shop, why settle for less when I can have such awesome experiences and awesome art from Outlaw! I can't tell them THANK YOU enough!

He took something I hated for years & created something I will love for years to come! While there Caroline was doing her thing with the piercings as well! name: Jennifer Johnson
text:
OUTLAW CUSTOM TATTOO is well organized, clean, and the staff are very professional. Nate is doing "cover-ups" on both of my daughters' tattoos.
The tattoo they wanted was in honor of their deceased grandmother and had been well thought out by them. The "IF"FY shop they went to for the tattoo did a terrible job. They were rude and condescending at the "IF"FY shop. Thinking that was the way tattoo shops were, my daughters went ahead with the tattoo. The "artist" messed it up so badly that a cover up is necessary. The "IF"FY shop even managed to tattoo the WRONG DEATH DATE on one of my daughters and tried to blame my daughter. We have the paper to prove they messed it up.
I called Outlaw and spoke with the owner, Steve. He was confident that his shop could help fix this mess.
The cover-up by Nate is only half-complete and already looks 100% better than the "finished" tattoo from the other shop. I really can not express how good this tattoo looks after one visit with Nate at Outlaw. He took his time, was patient and respectful with our questions. This has been a learning experience for my girls, but one thing we have all learned - not all shops are the same. I personally am not a fan of tattoos for myself, but if I were going to get one, I would definitely go see the guys at Outlaw. I would recommend this shop to anyone considering permanent art.

name: Megan Lee
text:
Let me start with the place was clean and had a nice vibe. I contacted them through Facebook looking to set an appointment for two scoop tongue piercings. I sent them a picture of what I wanted and I was told they could do it. I had to pay a 20 dollar deposit to book my appointment and pay the remainder when I got to the shop. First, I had to pay the remainder before even receiving my service which I can understand but that wasn't on their website, Facebook page or anything. Secondly, when I went back to get my piercing, the lady pulled out the wrong kind of bar. I stated,"that's too small. That's not what I want." I pulled my phone out to show her the pic I sent and she told me" yea we don't have that bar for that piercing." She was very like nonchalant. We kept trying to make small talk and ask
Questions and she just seemed annoyed like she didn't wanna deal with us.  So I became upset, because whoever I was talking to on the Facebook page said y'all could do that piercing. Never said y'all didn't have the materials to do so. So she proceeds to show my thicker bars but still not what I initially went there to get. I'm telling her like noo, this not what I wanted.  She asks if I want anything else because they don't do refunds. So I came and paid 70 dollars under the assumption I would get what I wanted, they didn't have it and I couldn't get a refund. MINUS ONE STAR.  So I tell her I'll wait while my sister gets hers done first because I was upset. She got ready to do my sisters. The dots she placed on my sisters tongue were symmetrical  and even, BUT once she pierced her tongue we both instantly noticed it was more so to the left, way left, then the center of her tongue. My sister said she was fine with it. Cool. So I got back in the chair to get mines. I wasn't about to waste 70 bucks. ALSO I FEEL A CUSTOMER SHOULD NOT PAY FOR A SERVICE BEFORE THEY GET IT DONE ! Seeing as how there are no refunds, which I was told after the fact, and then lied about being able to do what I wanted. Anyways, I get in the chair. She is drawing the dots on my tongue and had to mark my tongue like 3-4 times because then we're not even. When she finally gets it even and placed in the middle. Let me say the ink taste terrible! She proceeds to pierce and I can feel as soon as the needle went in and was not near the middle of my tongue. IMMEDIATELY I notice my Piercing is to the left of my tongue also. So I'm irritated all over again. I kept trying to show her how it wasn't in the middle and she says"it's just the way you holding your tongue." Lmao, this was horrible! So I continue to tell her it's not in the middle and she tells me we can take it out and redo it and I'm like fine. She then Says "well not right now I have other appointments coming."
Like NO you should finish with the appointment you already are in and I PAID ! So I leave and then I decided hell no. I'm getting this redone. I go back and she tells me to come back at 4. Two hours later. Cool.
I come back. Have to wait like 30 min. She finally calls be back to redo it. I'm showing her how it's NOT in the middle. The second time hurt like HELL because my tongue was already starting to swell from the first go round. She gets it in a much better position this time. It's closer to middle but VERY slanted. I said thanks and it looks MUCH better then before because it honestly does and I left. My sister wanted hers done over but she saw how painful mines was and neither of us should not have even had to go thru that. It should've been right the first time AND we should've got what we originally came for. So now my tongue is 2x swollen and sore because it had to go thru the trauma  twice ! Her hands were also shakey and normally when people pierce something like a tongue, they stand in front of you. Instead she was on the side which might have been the reason for them being sideways. Like I stated. The place was very clean and had a cool vibe. I just had a bad experience.

name: Amanda Whitlock
text: Tonight, I waited four hours for a four-line tattoo that I never received. If I could give zero stars, I would. I decided to come to Royal Spade after seeing a Facebook post about Friday the 13th tattoo specials. The Facebook post stated that they would be doing small 2-4 inch simple tattoo designs from 1-10pm and it specifically said Walk-In only. I arrived at the shop around 6:30pm and paid for my tattoo. At that point, there were five other people in the waiting area. As I waited, several other people came into the shop. I waited for a couple of hours as the people that came in before me got their tattoos done. At around 9:45, the receptionist called back people that arrived after I did. I was a little confused, so I went to the desk and asked the receptionist if I was next in line. She told me that there was one couple ahead of me but that I would be next after that. She asked what my tattoo was, and I told her it was the symbol for the air element, which was only a triangle with a line through it. She told me that she would try to squeeze me in next before the couple because my tattoo was so simple. At around 10:30, the couple that was ahead of me was called back. A few minutes later, another couple that arrived after me was called back. I went to the front desk and told the receptionist that I thought I was next. It was at this point that one of the tattoo artists came up and told me that they could not keep tattooing all night and that they could not accept walk-ins all night. I pointed out that people who arrived after me were called back, and that I had been there since 6:30pm. That is when he informed me that everyone that was called back had been in earlier that day and were told to come back later. I was dumbfounded that I was not told this once; not when I came in nor during the four-hour duration I spent waiting. I was not informed about any possibility that I would not be able to get my tattoo tonight until after I had been waiting four hours, and then was told that I could not get my tattoo. It also makes no sense to me why people could leave and come back for a special that was advertised as Walk-In only. I am extremely disappointed in the lack of organization and customer service of this shop and I would not wish this horrible experience on anyone.

resp.text: We already told you that we were sorry we cannot get to your tattoo, we were booked for the rest of the day. if you paid for your tattoo? you can come back for a refund tomorrow, but that's about it. we will not be able to help you with any other services in the future due to your lack of respect for us.

text: the man that did my tattoos was very nice but the tattoos turned out HORRIBLY.. they just turned into open scabs and one of them formed a water bubble as if it were a burn. I went back to show them the tattoo and the first thing that was asked was “did you get it here” .... KNOWING that they had JUST seen me.!! Then I was directed to another artist there who DID NOT do my tattoos and wasn’t even there the day i had got them and he clearly knew that something wasn’t right because he asked “what have you put on it.?!?” And I replied “aquaphor” because that’s what they recommended and that’s also what I used for my other previous tattoos. And then he tried to get smart saying how long he’s been in “the chair” and they couldn’t do anything until it “healed” But the thing is when this heals they wouldn’t be able to put ink on the spots that are MISSING SKIN and they KNOW IT. I was extremely polite until they tried to pass it off like they didn’t see my skin and the colored FLESH that was showing because the artist dug wayyy too deep. I was even okay with the artist not making the tattoo the color i wanted because he claimed he “couldn’t see well” that night so i went with a whole nother tattoo look than i was going for.& I thought it still turned out nicely until things took a turn for the worst.  I know how tattoos are supposed to heal because I have them and have went to MULTIPLE ARTISTS so It’s not me being “picky” or rude . I at least wanted them to be more concerned but I couldn’t get an apology, an offer to make things right, or even my money back. But I have contacted my lawyer and I will have to make the necessary steps.!! Like I said the man who did the tatt was  NICE as ever but he dug too deep and it left permanent damage on both tats and it could’ve went differently had they at least acknowledged what was wrong. Truly sad the way things were handled/not handled.!! No one wants to have messed up skin especially in a place where it’s visible to people. I trusted them with my skin and the art but got done horribly.. this is why I believe with some places you need to just pay half or pay after the work is done and even if you pay before hand, if something goes wrong because of THEM and you go to them in a polite manner even though this is your body so you have a reason to be alarm and HEATED ....then they should at least do everything in their power to make it right and pay you back and try to fix it. But like I said there’s no fixing this and they knew it that’s why I had to take legal action. Not trying to bash their business or anything because my first initial thought was “they’re pretty nice people and it’s a cool space” when i first walked in to set the appointment but as far as my experience and things .... I definitely won’t be going there again and the way they handled my situation.. I highly wouldn’t recommend and that’s just me.!!
